Description

Astropy’s regions affiliated package is being developed to handle description and manipulation of regions on the sky and in images. STC-S “Space-Time Coordinate (STC) Metadata” is a specification for a string representation of regions on the sky. It is similar to ds9 and CASA regions in that it has a well-defined standard. The goal of this project is simply to implement this language into astropy-regions. The complete project will involve writing input-output tools including a parser and a serializer. It will include a suite of tests, including round-trip tests to and from the CRTF and ds9 region formats. There is a good deal of code already written that may be portable into astropy-regions.

Milestones (if any)

  1. Implementation of basic region reading
  2. Implementation of a writer
  3. Roundtrip testing with CRTF, DS9
  4. Tests against existing implementations
  5. Expansion of 3D support for STC-S and CRTF regions
